title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

items.title: One of the hardest jobs in business: Being a ‘sponsor’ that protects rising female execs
items.description: Rosalind Chow writes about the surprising rules of sponsorship in her new book "The Doors You Can Open."

items.title: A new wrinkle for executive comp at BlackRock and Goldman Sachs could become the norm across finance
items.description: Carried interest is no longer just for PE firms.

items.title: Former Sen. Bob Mendendez, angling for a pardon for his 11-year prison sentence, says he hopes Trump ‘cleans up the cesspool and restores the integrity to the system’
items.description: Menendez, 71, has been called "Gold Bar Bob" for accepting bribes of gold and cash and acting as an agent of Egypt.
